intro: Limonium palmyrense, commonly known as the Palmyrene sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces clusters of small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family, which includes other salt-tolerant species. Limonium palmyrense is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to flourish in harsh, saline environments.
